DOC.brief_summary: The investigators hypothesize that a 6-week treatment of non-invasive spinal decompression reduces discogenic low back pain (LBP), increases lumbar disk height, and that an increase in lumbar disc height is associated with decreased LBP.
DOC.brief_title: Restoration of Disc Height Reduces Chronic Low Back Pain
DOC.criteria: at least 18 years of age; consented for the 6 weeks treatment protocol; presented with discogenic low back pain of at least 3 out of 10; AND current CT scan not older than 2 months. metastatic cancer; previous spinal fusion or placement of stabilization hardware; instrumentation or artificial discs; neurologic motor deficits, bladder, or sexual dysfunction; alcohol or drug abuse; OR litigation for a healthrelated claim (in process or pending for workers' compensation or personal injury). Limitations of the spinal decompression system also led to the exclusion of patients with extremes of height (< 147 cm or > 203 cm) and body weight (> 136 kg).
